com.esri.mo2.map.img
Class BaseImageServerLayer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseLayer
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseGroupLayer
              |
              +--com.esri.mo2.map.img.BaseImageServerLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, DatasetLayer, GroupLayer, ImageLayer, ImageServerLayer, Layer, Searchable
public class BaseImageServerLayer
extends BaseGroupLayer
implements ImageServerLayer

A type of GroupLayer that presents the embedded Layers of an ImageServer.

See Also:
LayerSource

isOpaque

public boolean isOpaque()
Determines if transparency has been set. Returns false currently, since we have no way of knowing about transparency. A complete redraw alway occurs for Server images.

Specified by:
isOpaque in interface DatasetLayer
Returns:
a boolean value - True == opaque, else False == otherwise

                  double scale,
                  int width,

createSpatialSearchFilter

public BaseSpatialFilter createSpatialSearchFilter(FeatureGeometry geometry,
                                                   Fields fields)
Constructs a BaseMapImageFilter that is suitable for use with an ImageServer queryTile(). This only works if the current ImageServerLayer has been added to the Layerset of a Map

Specified by:
createSpatialSearchFilter in interface DatasetLayer
Parameters:
geometry - the selection geometry
fields - the query fields, or null == get all the Fields from the Dataset (providing the Dataset is of type Table)
See Also:
DatasetLayer.search(Envelope,Fields), ImageServer.queryTile(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope, java.awt.Dimension, com.esri.mo2.map.img.SubLayerSnapshot)

getCanChange

public boolean getCanChange()
Description copied from interface: ImageServerLayer
Returns the status of the CanChange property. If this property is set to 'True', then you can dynamically add, remove, or move layers within the ImageServerLayer. Not all ImageServerLayers are capable of this - in those cases, once the layer has been constructed, they cannot be changed.

Specified by:
getCanChange in interface ImageServerLayer
Returns:
the CanChange property
See Also:
ImageServerLayer.getCanChange()

setCanChangeOnScale

public void setCanChangeOnScale(boolean b)
Provides a way for subclasses to set the CanChangeOnScale property. Default value is false.

See Also:
setCanChange(boolean)

getCanChangeOnScale

public boolean getCanChangeOnScale()
Description copied from interface: ImageServerLayer
An ImageServer implementation may provide support for modifying the contents of an ImageServerLayer dependent on the returned map scale.

Specified by:
getCanChangeOnScale in interface ImageServerLayer
Returns:
a boolean value - True == ImageServerLayer supports scale-dependent modifications by server, False otherwise.
See Also:
ImageServerLayer.getCanChangeOnScale()

draw

public void draw(DisplayArea displayArea,
                 int drawPhase)
          throws InterruptedException
For phase == DRAW_FEATURE, this method draws the map image. Nothing is drawn for phase == DRAW_SELECT or DRAW_LABEL.

Specified by:
draw in interface Layer
Overrides:
draw in class BaseLayer
Parameters:
displayArea - the portion of a display
drawPhase - one of the draw phase identifiers
Throws:
InterruptedException - if Layer drawing has been cancelled (usually because of a new zoom or pan)
See Also:
Layer.draw(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int)
